extendedIngredients.name: canned pumpkin
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1/2 cup pumpkin (canned not pumpkin pie filling)

extendedIngredients.name: marshmallow creme
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 jar (7 oz) marshmallow creme (also known as fluff)

extendedIngredients.name: pecans
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 cup pecans - whole for garnish or chopped for adding to fudge
metaInformation: for garnish or  for adding to fudge

recipes.title: Pumpkin Pie Fudge
recipes.instructions: Add foil to 8x8 pan and spray very lightly with cooking spray In a large bowl, add white chocolate chips and marshmallow creme Combine Truvia Baking Blend, Brown Sugar Blend, milk, pumpkin,butter and pumpkin pie spice in a medium saucepan. Bring mixture to boil, stirring constantly, add candy thermometer to side of pan. Boil until mixture reaches the soft ball stage, 234 to 240 F. Mine took 20 minutes, cooking time will depend on how much liquid in the pumpkin.  Carefully pour hot mixture over chips and marshmallow creme, stirring immediately and vigorously - you want the chips to melt quickly, because when the mixture cools down they won't melt.  Stir in vanilla extract Pour mixture into prepared pan and let set on counter for 2 hours or until completely cooled Wrap tightly and refrigerate several hours or overnight until set To cut, lift foil from pan and cut into small pieces

steps.step: Add foil to 8x8 pan and spray very lightly with cooking spray In a large bowl, add white chocolate chips and marshmallow creme

Combine Truvia Baking Blend, Brown Sugar Blend, milk, pumpkin,butter and pumpkin pie spice in a medium saucepan. Bring mixture to boil, stirring constantly, add candy thermometer to side of pan. Boil until mixture reaches the soft ball stage, 234 to 240 F. Mine took 20 minutes, cooking time will depend on how much liquid in the pumpkin.  Carefully pour hot mixture over chips and marshmallow creme, stirring immediately and vigorously - you want the chips to melt quickly, because when the mixture cools down they won't melt.  Stir in vanilla extract

Pour mixture into prepared pan and let set on counter for 2 hours or until completely cooled Wrap tightly and refrigerate several hours or overnight until set To cut, lift foil from pan and cut into small pieces
